meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support clothing or hold weapons.
meanings.sent1: She tightened her belt before heading out for a walk.
meanings.sent2: His belt matched his shoes perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The belt held up his pants but also doubled as a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The belt of the forest seemed to stretch endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy's belt gleamed in the sunlight as he rode into town.

meanings.definition: A continuous band of material used to transmit motion or power.
meanings.sent1: The conveyor belt moved the packages along swiftly.
meanings.sent2: The engine's timing belt needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The belt of electricity powered the entire factory.
meanings.sent4: The belt of wind turbines hummed in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The belt of gears turned smoothly, transferring energy efficiently.

meanings.definition: A blow or stroke with a belt.
meanings.sent1: He received a belt on the backside for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler delivered a powerful belt to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The playful belt on the shoulder made him jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The belt of the ruler echoed through the classroom, silencing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The belt of the drum reverberated through the concert hall.

meanings.sent1: The tropical belt is known for its lush vegetation.
meanings.sent2: The desert belt stretches for miles under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The belt of farmland provided a picturesque view from above.
meanings.sent4: The mountain belt was a challenging terrain for hikers.
meanings.sent5: The coastal belt offered stunning views of the ocean.
